questions.title: It’s important to me that everyone has a voice
Everyone’s contribution should be formally recognized
I think it’s important that workers and shareholders get dividends for their hard work
It’s OK that some people can contribute more than others
I like to encourage people to take more responsibility within the group
I want to be able to meet with the group on a regular basis
The group will follow its own set of agreed rules/guidelines
The group will adopt a pre-set rules
I’m good at managing groups of people’s time
It’s easy to make decisions because we are all friends
I like working with people who I’m already friends with because it means we get on well
When there is disagreement, we’re able to resolve it
I like to work with people who challenge my ideas
It’s important to me that the organisation is bigger than just me
It’s important that I have shares in the company.
The thing that worries me most is the potential for being ousted from my own business by my own board!
I like to be in control and driving most decisions
I’m a control freak and like things to be done my way
I want to be seen as the figurehead of the group
It’s my baby
I’d like a clear separation between my role as the founder/CEO and a ‘board’
Roles and job titles are important
It’s important to me that I’m on my own board
I don’t want to do this on my own
Everyone should have a say in how the company is run
I need to be able to take a step back from the group from time to time
It’s important to get other people involved with running the group
It’s important to know who ‘owns’ the project
Community work can be quite isolating
I want the group to be seen as an example of good practice to other groups
I want to be able to influence local services provision
I need people to commit a specific amount of time if they are to join the group
A big part of how we will raise money will be through donations
It’s OK to ask for donations to cover costs
I think fundraising will be important to us and I want to be able to raise funds on Just Giving
I’m going to need a charitable number to help me fundraise
My volunteers are going to want to fundraise for us and raise money online
My biggest source of income is likely to be through grants
It’s important that I get shares and dividends for my hard work
It’s important that members of the group can get paid
It’s important to me that my project can generate its own revenue
The group can only continue with a new funding source
I see my project being more as a self-financing business with a social goal, rather than a charitable organisation
It’s important to me that people know we are a charitable organisation
In 10 years time I want the group to be turning over £100,000
The group should raise a charge for providing a service
The group should offer the service free of charge
I want to share some of the money with a national organization
Members should pay a regular fee for being part of the group
It’s likely I’ll be taking on employees soon
I’m hoping to land some BIG contracts!
We’ll be wanting to buy a building soon
The group can only survive if there’s someone with financial expertise
I want to be able to take a step back from the group once it is established
I want to see the group expanding to other locations in the future
Increasing/attracting new members is important to me
Employing/paying/being paid to do the work is important to me
Managing and developing volunteers should be a key part of the group
Admin tasks are boring and time consuming
I don’t mind it I find myself doing community work in my own time
